comments: Contains A003598. In general n=p^iq^i => n|Sum[k=1..2p, k^n], where p, q=2p+1 prime (see Meyer ref).
links: C. Meyer, On a conjecture arising from the OEIS
mathematica: Do[ If[ Mod[ PowerMod[ 10, n, n ] + PowerMod[ 9, n, n ] + PowerMod[ 8, n, n ] + PowerMod[ 7, n, n ] + PowerMod[ 6, n, n ] + PowerMod[ 5, n, n ] + PowerMod[ 4, n, n ] + PowerMod[ 3, n, n ] + PowerMod[ 2, n, n ] + 1, n ] == 0, Print[ n ] ], {n, 1, 10^6} ]Select[Range[700000],Divisible[Total[Range[10]^#],#]&] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Nov 24 2014 *)
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 25 2000
